header.title: Practical Atlantean Magic: A Study of the Science, Mysticism and Theurgy of Ancient Atlantis

central_thesis: This book aims to explore the science, mysticism, and theurgy of Ancient Atlantis from a predominantly metaphysical angle, integrating historical, geological, geographical data, and psychic insights. It posits that Atlantean 'magic' was an advanced science based on cosmic laws, with a structured priesthood that understood multidimensional realities, stellar influences (especially Sirius), and the interplay of Chaos and Order, offering practical rites for spiritual development and protection.

structure_content.summary: Introduces Atlantis as a civilization deeply etched in the collective unconscious, arguing against purely 'rational' dismissal. The author's approach is primarily metaphysical, drawing on intuition, 'far memory', and collaborations with psychics and channelers, alongside scientific data, to present a holistic picture of Atlantis's history and relevance.

Discusses geological theories of early landmasses (Pangaea, Gondwanaland, Lurasia) and continental drift, particularly Alfred Wegener's theory. Introduces the lost continent of Mu/Lemuria, its culture, destruction (c. 33000-15000 BC), and its influence on nascent Atlantean civilization. Explores stellar influences and astrological ages (Piscean, Arien, Taurean, Geminian, Cancerian, Leonine, Virgoan, Libran, Scorpionic) as defining periods for planetary and human evolution.

Details the cataclysm that sank Mu, causing major geophysical changes and the emergence of Atlantis as a distinct island continent. Discusses early Atlantean colonizers in America and Europe, drawing parallels with accounts of ancient civilizations and their advanced knowledge (e.g., Kogi Indians, Egyptian records of Shemsu-Hor). Emphasizes the cosmic perspective on Earth's changing axis and its impact on ancient cultures.

Examines Plato's accounts of Atlantis in 'Critias' and 'Timaeus', noting the Hellenized names and potential historical confusions. Provides a detailed description of Plato's Atlantean capital, its geography, resources, architecture, and governance by Poseidon's descendants. Introduces the concept of a 'divine gene' and its dilution through interbreeding as a cause for Atlantean decline, linking it to extraterrestrial influence or 'panspermia' theories.

Reviews alternative proposed locations for Atlantis (Thera, Tartessos, Tunisia, Africa, Americas, Yucatan, Antarctica, Sahara, North Sea) before settling on Plato's Atlantic island continent. Discusses geological and cartographical evidence supporting an Atlantic location and highlights the significance of Earth's axial tilts and changes in sea level (e.g., Hapgood, Mooney). Presents a chronological table of approximate dates for Atlantean history, aligning with astrological ages and ancient records.

Focuses on the size and climate of Atlantis, its position relative to the equator and poles. Discusses Edgar Cayce's readings on Atlantean geography and the concept of an earlier 360-day year with five 'epagomenal' days, linking it to the moon's position. Explores theories of human height being influenced by lunar proximity and contrasts earlier Atlantean conditions with later periods.

Investigates the genetic makeup of Atlanteans, citing discoveries of tall skeletons and unusual DNA strains. Discusses the 'extraterrestrial gene' theory (panspermia or spiritual refinement) and the Atlantean genetic pool, drawing on the 'Oera Linda Book' for descriptions of white, yellow, and black 'Earth Mothers'. Explores blood group distributions (A and O) as indicators of Atlantean ancestry and outlines different races and their migrations. Also covers the Atlantean system of writing, linking it to ancient traditions of pre-Flood writing.

Describes Atlantean science as an integrated system of physics and metaphysics, governed by a priesthood skilled in both left- and right-brain studies. Explores the concept of the quasi-crystal (five-fold symmetry) as a key to Atlantean understanding of time and cosmic connections, especially with Sirius. Details the 'Crystals Cult', including the Firestone as a central power station for energy and healing, and other advanced technologies like lasers, sonics (for communication, sterilization, surgery), and cosmology (knowledge of 12 planets, Sirius system).

Outlines the three tiers of Atlantean religion: secular State, metaphysical doctrines for healers/scholars, and higher occult teachings for senior priests. Focuses on the Solar State Religion during the Virgoan Age, acknowledging a single Creative Source with multiple manifestations (Neters). Describes telluric and cosmic energies, Four Great Seasonal Festivals (Fire, Air, Water, Earth), and the integration of religion into daily life, including priestly sociology, free public services (education, medicine), and the barter system.

Defines Atlantean magic as 'supreme wisdom' or 'sacred philosophy', rooted in scientific fact but encompassing metaphysics and the interplay of Chaos/Order. Explains that magic was exclusive to the priesthood and compartmentalized into healing, science, and Cosmic Magic (balancing Earth forces, solar system, Sirius). Discusses Atlantean magical symbology (equidistant cross, Winged Disk, Ankh, Caduceus, Sacred Eye) and the concept of subtle bodies (Sahu, Khu, Ba, Ka, Sekhem, Ab, Khaibit, Ren, Khat) and 'soul-age'. Outlines Atlantean Magical Laws (Rebound, Three Requests, Equalities, etc.) and initiatory exercises for mental space-time travel and communication with alien intelligences.

Details the highly structured Atlantean priesthood, their selection based on initial 'Judgement' and developed skills, and their administrative roles. Describes their distinct apparel, colors (white, blue, green robes; sashes, headbands), and symbols (jewels, winged disk) signifying rank and specialization. Explains initiation garments, healing methods (holistic, combining practical medicine, auric repair, counselling), Orders of Passage (rites of birth, maturation, union, menopause, death), and the profound influence of Sirius on Atlantean knowledge and racial origins.

Examines theories on the final sinking of Atlantis: asteroids (Muck), axial tilts (Hapgood, Warlow), lunar theories (Hoerbiger, Bellamy), and chaos science. Presents metaphysical interpretations, including Plato's idea of divine punishment due to human degeneracy ('divine gene' dilution) and psychic accounts from Tony Neate, George Ch. Pisanis, Edgar Cayce, Helena Blavatsky, Rudolf Steiner, and Daphne Vigers, all describing a moral and spiritual decline leading to catastrophe. Includes the author's own 'far memory' experiences.

Discusses prophecies of Atlantis's return, often linked to impending global catastrophes and the rise of a 'new race' of evolved people. Highlights Edgar Cayce's predictions of geographical changes (breaking up of America, sinking Japan, reappearance of lands) and Daphne Vigers' vision of Atlantis's physical re-emergence from the sea. Concludes with a practical rite for 'Healing and Protection of Danuih, the Earth Mother', designed for supplicants to channel love and energy to Gaia and invoke Khiet-Sin for intervention.

key_concepts.definition: Not distinct from advanced science; a system of knowledge and practice based on a comprehensive understanding of cosmic laws, quantum mechanics, and metaphysics, enabling control over physical and subtle realities. It was practiced by the priesthood for societal good and spiritual evolution, eschewing mundane or emotionally-driven magic.

Fundamental universal principles recognized by Atlanteans. Chaos, though eventually self-organizing, brings suffering, while Order represents stability and structured evolution. The goal of Atlantean practice was to negotiate Chaos without losing identity, aiming for balance between these extremes.

A genetic inheritance believed to be derived from interbreeding between an alien species (possibly Siriun) and early Homo sapiens. It imbues its carriers with spiritual sensitivity and virtue, and its dilution was seen by Plato as contributing to the eventual downfall of Atlantis.

A strange material with five-fold rotational symmetry, unlike normal crystals. In Atlantean science, it represents the fifth dimension, timelessness, and cosmic connections, especially with the binary star Sirius. Its true nature was a guarded secret of the higher priesthood.

A giant crystal located in the Great Temple of the Atlantean capital, serving as the central power station. It concentrated and transmitted the sun's rays as visible beams (similar to radio waves) for energy and healing. Its misuse contributed to Atlantis's destruction.

Five (or sometimes six in a leap year) extra days added to the original 360-day Atlantean year, marked by a change in Earth's orbital path in relation to the moon. These days were significant for the arrival of the Great Neters (deities) in ancient Egyptian tradition, linking cosmic events to the Atlantean catastrophe.

The original eight principal deities of Atlantis, whose energies resonated with the octagonal recesses of the Great High Temple. They included Helio (male solar), Heliona (female solar), Ta-Khu (Lord of Time and Space, Siriun ancestor), Khe-Ta (Consort of Ta-Khu, feline divinity), Khiet-Sin (Leonine goddess), Danuih (Earth goddess), Philaeia (wisdom, science), and Akhantuih (Negotiator of Chaos).

A metaphysical concept referring to a universal library of all events, thoughts, and experiences. In the context of Atlantis, it's considered a source of 'far memory' or 'mental projection through Time' where past, present, and future exist simultaneously, accessible to psychics and mystics.

Cosmic energies originating from the binary star Sirius, believed by Atlanteans to be the parent star of our Sun and the orchestrator of all events on Earth. Siriun energies are associated with specific numbers (5, 7, 8, 50) and represent a 'time-gateway' for intelligent life in our galaxy.

A set of fundamental principles governing Atlantean magic, understood as scientific facts. These include the Law of Rebound, Law of Three Requests, Law of Challenge, Law of Equalities, Law of Balance or Equipoise, Law of Summons, Law of Polarities, Law of Cause and Effect, and Law of Abundance (Opulence). They reflect interconnectedness in a 'hidden' or 'enfolded' universe.

Beyond the physical form, Atlanteans understood various non-physical aspects of being. Drawing parallels with Egyptian concepts, these include the Sahu (spiritual), Khu (magical essence), Ba (etheric), Ka (astral), Sekhem (soul-frequency/power), Ab (emotions), Khaibit (shadow/unconscious), Ren (personal sonic), and Khat (physical). Attainment of these is linked to spiritual progress and 'cosmic maturity'.

practical_system.description: The Atlantean practical system is rooted in a highly structured, scientifically-informed priesthood that integrates metaphysical understanding with daily life. It encompasses solar worship, elemental rites, healing practices, and advanced Cosmic Magic. The system emphasizes balancing Chaos and Order, spiritual development, and maintaining harmony with planetary and stellar energies. Rituals involve specific postures, visualizations, invocations, and offerings, aiming for energetic exchange and spiritual transformation.

relevant_quotes.text: When dealing with a subject of this nature it should be always borne in mind that the dividing line between reality and fantasy is an extremely fine one, and to steer a steady course between the absurd and the prejudiced is no easy task. It inevitably falls to the metaphysician to walk the tightrope between reason and intuition, and a careful balance between right and left brain hemisphere input must therefore be aimed for at all times.

The Atlantean continent was flat in the north and inclined to be dry although it was by no means barren. Most of the mountain ranges of the continent lay to the south and it is said that the topmost peaks coincide with the islands of the Azores; although it would be difficult to equate any existing land-masses with parts of the continent, as the topography changed so drastically at the time of the tilt. Its northern zone was extremely warm, its central or temperate zone enjoyed the type of climate you would associate with the South Sea Islands, and its southern zone was somewhat cooler – more like southern England or Northern France. These three zones were given names that resonated to their particular elemental atmospheres. The northern zone was called Portea, the central zone, Cintrala and the southern zone Usiqua. There were cities, towns and villages throughout the continent that were mainly circular in shape, well irrigated and beautifully kept. Colour was used profusely in both dwellings and temples, and sharp angles were always avoided.

The Atlanteans were fully aware of the nature of what we now call quantum mechanics, while also possessing an advanced knowledge of sonics and genetics. By understanding that certain laws of physics operated exactly the same way in the human experience as they do in every other avenue of existence, the scientist-priests were able to measure the precise sonic, genetic, particle and wave frequencies of each individual. This information was then incorporated into a kind of composite 'energized graph' (the equivalent of the modern-day computer?). The graph was then matched against similar graphs that had been erected for a variety of callings from the most intellectually demanding to the most menial.

MY SPIRIT CONTROLS MY MIND AND MY MIND CONTROLS MY BODY. Now, cross the arms over the head so that the palm of the left hand is pressed against the right upper side of the head and vice versa with the left hand, linking both thumbs at the top. Drop the head slightly backwards and look upwards. Repeat the words: MY LOGIC CONTROLS MY INTUITION AND MY INTUITION TEMPERS MY LOGIC. THUS, WITH THE GUIDANCE OF AKHANTUIH, I MAY PASS IN SAFETY THROUGH THE REGIONS OF CHAOS AND THE DARK PLACES OF FEAR, AND IN RETURN FOR THIS BLESSING I PROMISE TO GIVE AKHANTUIH SEVEN MINUTES OF MY DAY, TO BE SPENT IN MENTAL DISCIPLINE, PROGRAMMING, AND BALANCING THE TWO HEMISPHERES OF MY BRAIN.

I INVOKE YOU, CELESTIAL LIONESS, GUARDIAN OF THE JUST AND PROTECTOR OF THOSE WHO SERVE THE LIGHT, AND HUMBLY REQUEST YOUR DIVINE INTERVENTION, NOT FOR MYSELF, BUT FOR YOUR COSMIC SISTER, DANUIH, WHO IS SUFFERING AT THE HANDS OF MY SPECIES. I ASK THAT YOU FREE HER FROM HER OPPRESSORS SO THAT SHE MAY PROGRESS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE AGE OF HER BODY AND SPIRIT. IN RETURN I GIVE YOU MY LOVE, AN ACKNOWLEDGEMENT OF THE POWER AND NATURE OF YOUR ENERGIES, AND A PROMISE TO WORK BY YOUR SIDE TO THIS END AS YOU IN YOUR WISDOM MAY DEEM FIT.

critical_analysis.relevance: This book contributes significantly to esoteric literature by providing a cohesive framework for Atlantean magic, moving beyond mere speculation. It integrates diverse sources—classical philosophy, geological data, ancient myths, and channeled information—to construct a detailed, practical system. The emphasis on the scientific basis of Atlantean magic, particularly quantum mechanics, sonics, and genetics, positions it as a bridge between scientific and occult paradigms, challenging traditional 'hocus pocus' notions. The detailed descriptions of the Atlantean priesthood, their societal role, and specific rituals offer a unique operational manual for those seeking to engage with this particular current. By linking Atlantean cosmology to Sirius, it opens up avenues for understanding extraterrestrial influences within magical practice, a key theme in modern esotericism.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience includes practitioners of Western Esotericism and Occultism, particularly those interested in Atlantean lore, cosmic magic, and planetary healing. It is also suitable for students of ancient civilizations, metaphysics, and transpersonal psychology who are open to integrating intuitive and channeled information with historical and scientific inquiry. The practical rites make it appealing to individuals seeking structured magical work for spiritual development, protection, and connection with Earth and cosmic energies.
